title: phdcocktail
text: phdcocktail toolkit functions help: ) effortlessly transform collected data publication-ready format, ii) generate insightful visualizations clinical data, iii) report summary statistics publication-ready format, iv) efficiently export, save reload R objects within framework R projects.

title: phdcocktail
text: can install development version phdcocktail GitHub :

what: Delete files from the 'output' folder — delete_output
title: Delete files from the 'output' folder — delete_output
text: Delete files 'output' folder

title: Delete files from the 'output' folder — delete_output
Delete files from the 'output' folder — delete_output
text: folder folder user wishes delete files. default folder 'output'. argument user can specify file deleted. 3 valid character values argument: ) 'except-r' option, delete files except R script data files, ii) '' option, delete files specified folder, iii) 'extensions' option, specify extensions deleted. default behaviour 'except-r'. extensions character vector indicating extensions files user wishes delete. default extensions excel extensions.

title: Delete files from the 'output' folder — delete_output
text: message listing files deleted.

title: Delete files from the 'output' folder — delete_output

what: Export files to the 'output' folder — export_safely
title: Export files to the 'output' folder — export_safely
text: Export files 'output' folder

title: Export files to the 'output' folder — export_safely
code: export_safely(   data,   folder = "output/data",   name = NULL,   format = "xlsx",   overwrite = FALSE,   time_in_name = FALSE,   ... )

title: Export files to the 'output' folder — export_safely
text: data object exported. folder folder object need exported. default 'data' folder within 'output' folder. name name exported file. name provided, file inherit object's name. format format exported file. Default 'xlsx'. overwrite logical indicate whether preexisting files identical names overwritten. Default 'FALSE'. time_in_name logical indicate whether timestamp included file's name. ... argument can passed 'rio::export'

title: Export files to the 'output' folder — export_safely
text: message indicating full path exported file.

title: Export files to the 'output' folder — export_safely
Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) datasets — ibd_data1
text: 'ibd_data1' 'ibd_data2' two small datasets containing data collected IBD patients, specifically patients Crohn's disease. 'ibd_data2' modified version 'ibd_data1' introducing missing incorrect entries 'L11' column 'disease_location'.

title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) datasets — ibd_data1
Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) datasets — ibd_data1
text: Two data frames 30 rows six columns: patientid Patient ID gender Gender disease_location Disease location disease_behaviour Disease behaviour crp_mg_l C-reactive protein (mg/L) calprotectin_ug_g Faecal calprotectin (ug/g)

what: Data dictionary for Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) data — ibd_data_dict
title: Data dictionary for Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) data — ibd_data_dict
text: small, non-exhaustive list variables commonly collected IBD research. variable levels, applicable, publications-ready labels provided

title: Data dictionary for Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) data — ibd_data_dict
Data dictionary for Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) data — ibd_data_dict
text: data frame 53 rows four columns: variable Variable name 'collection', .e. 'excel', form variable_label Variable name publication form value Value name 'collection', .e. 'excel', form value_label Value name publication form

title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) outcomes — ibd_outcomes
text: table containing proportions percentages IBD patients achieving clinical outcomes.

title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) outcomes — ibd_outcomes
Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) outcomes — ibd_outcomes
text: data frame eight rows seven columns: outcome Outcome type timepoint Assessment timepoint achieved Number patients achieved outcome total Total number patients proportion Proportion patients achieved outcome percentage Percentage patients achieved outcome percentage_labelled Percentage patients achieved outcome, suffixed '%'

title: Plot % of outcomes as bars — plot_bars
code: plot_bars(   data,   outcome,   proportion,   percentage_labelled,   achieved,   total,   x_axis_title = NULL,   y_axis_title = "% Patients",   legend_title = "Outcome",   bar_fill = "Greys",   grouping = NULL )

title: Plot % of outcomes as bars — plot_bars
text: data data frame containing outcomes data. outcome Variable containing outcomes plotted. proportion Variable containing proportion patients achieved outcome. percentage_labelled Variable containing percentage patients achieved outcome, suffixed '%' label. achieved Variable containing number patients achieved outcome. total Variable containing total number patients. x_axis_title Title x-axis. y_axis_title Title y-axis. legend_title Title legend. bar_fill Fill color bars. grouping Faceting variable.

title: Plot % of outcomes as bars — plot_bars

Recode variables and their levels based on a data dictionary — recode_vrs
text: data data frame raw data. data_dictionary data dictionary containing labels variables levels. vrs character vector specifying variables recoded. factor logical indicate whether recoded variables need converted factors.

title: Recode variables and their levels based on a data dictionary — recode_vrs
text: input data frame recoded labelled variables.

title: Recode variables and their levels based on a data dictionary — recode_vrs
code: if (FALSE) { ibd_data_recoded <- recode_vrs(data = ibd_data1, data_dictionary = ibd_data_dict, vrs = c("disease_location", "disease_behaviour", "gender"), factor = TRUE) }

Report median-quantiles summaries — report_quantiles

what: Save global objects to the 'output' folder — save_work
title: Save global objects to the 'output' folder — save_work
text: Save global objects 'output' folder

title: Save global objects to the 'output' folder — save_work
code: save_work(   folder = "output/Rdata",   name = "analysis",   objects_to_save = NULL,   time_in_name = TRUE )

title: Save global objects to the 'output' folder — save_work
text: folder folder workspace objects need saved. default 'Rdata' folder within 'output' folder. name name saved workspace. name provided, name 'analysis'. objects_to_save vector specifying objects workspace need saved. default 'NULL', save objects global environment. time_in_name logical indicate whether timestamp included workspace's name.

title: Save global objects to the 'output' folder — save_work
text: message indicating full path saved 'Rdata' file. message also list objects saved within file, list also documented accompanying 'txt' document.

title: Save global objects to the 'output' folder — save_work
